headline.main: FAVORS' ADMITTED AT NAZI SPY TRIAL; But Chief Steward Remembers Only One Incident, When He Took Diapers to Rome

lead_paragraph: Conradin Otto Dold, a defendant in the Brooklyn espionage trial, readily admitted on the witness stand yesterday that he had carried "packages" abroad for influential clients while he was serving as chief steward aboard vessels of the American Export Line.
abstract: C O Dold denies he carried espionage data to Eur; testifies on meetings with Sebold
